A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I don’t understand why other fans didn’t like this movie very much. I thought it was great. The only reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars is because they left too many unanswered questions. The plot was not as strong as Episode 7. I thought Luke could have been utilized better. I think Disney is trying to be too “politically correct” by hinting at the idea that you can be a nobody and still be amazingly force-sensitive\, and that it doesn’t have to be inherited. The old “when you wish upon a star\, you’re dreams come true” routine. Aside from that obvious theme\, I think the acting was well done\, the special effects were awesome\, and the interesting link between Rey and Kylo-Ren is worth exploring in a sequel. My suggestion is to ignore critics and love this new chapter of Star Wars despite a few holes.
